sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Uniform Interstate
Service of subpoena. A subpoena issued by a clerk of court under Section 3 must be served in compliance with Illinois Supreme Court Rules 204 and 237 and Section 2-1101 of the Code of Civil Procedure
sections.text: Service of subpoena. A subpoena issued by a clerk of court under Section 3 must be served in compliance with Illinois Supreme Court Rules 204 and 237 and Section 2-1101 of the Code of Civil Procedure.

sections.heading: Deposition, production, and inspection. With respect to depositions, production
sections.text: of documents or other tangible items, or inspections of premises, Illinois Supreme Court Rules 204 and 237 and Section 2-1101 of the Code of Civil Procedure apply to subpoenas issued under Section 3.

sections.heading: Application to court. An application to the court for a protective order or to enforce, quash, or modify a subpoena issued by a clerk of court under Section 3 must comply with the rules or statutes of this State and be submitted to the court in the county in which discovery is to be conducted
sections.text: Application to court. An application to the court for a protective order or to enforce, quash, or modify a subpoena issued by a clerk of court under Section 3 must comply with the rules or statutes of this State and be submitted to the court in the county in which discovery is to be conducted.

sections.heading: Uniformity of application and construction
sections.text: In applying and construing this uniform Act, consideration must be given to the need to promote uniformity of the law with respect to its subject matter among states that enact it.

sections.heading: Application to pending actions. This Act applies to
sections.text: requests for discovery in cases pending on the effective date of this Act.

sections.heading: Limitation. A subpoena issued under this Act may not require compliance outside a deponent's county of residence in the State of Illinois.
sections.text: Limitation. A subpoena issued under this Act may not require compliance outside a deponent's county of residence in the State of Illinois.
